alert.note: Alert for Brown; Jackson; Marshall; Nemaha (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 9:13AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Nemaha, northeastern Jackson, Brown and northeastern Marshall Counties through 1000 AM CDT... At 911 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm outflow boundary along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Humboldt to near Sabetha to 3 miles south of Corning. Movement was east at 50 mph. There may be some stronger winds with the thunderstorms trailing the outflow boundary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hiawatha, Sabetha, Seneca, Horton, Centralia, Axtell, Wetmore, Everest, Fairview, Robinson, Morrill, Beattie, Whiting, Bern, Corning, Summerfield, Netawaka, Goff, Vermillion and Reserve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for northeastern Kansas.
